get.description: Lists the current availability status for all the resources in the subscription.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Setting $expand=recommendedactions in url query expands the recommendedactions in the response.

200.description: The list of current availability status for all the resources in the subscription

items.description: availabilityStatus of a resource.

id.description: Azure Resource Manager Identity for the availabilityStatuses resource.

type.description: Microsoft.ResourceHealth/AvailabilityStatuses.

location.description: Azure Resource Manager geo location of the resource.

availabilityState.description: Availability status of the resource. When it is null, this availabilityStatus object represents an availability impacting event

title.description: Title description of the availability status.

summary.description: Summary description of the availability status.

reasonType.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are planned, unplanned, user initiated or an outage etc.

context.description: When an event is created, it can either be triggered by a customer or the platform of the resource and this field will illustrate that. This field is connected to the category field in this object.

category.description: When a context field is set to Platform, this field will reflect if the event was planned or unplanned. If the context field does not have a value of Platform, then this field will be ignored.

rootCauseAttributionTime.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it provides the Timestamp for when the health impacting event was received.

healthEventType.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes when the health impacting event was originated. Examples are Lifecycle, Downtime, Fault Analysis etc.

healthEventCause.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are PlatformInitiated, UserInitiated etc.

healthEventCategory.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes the category of a PlatformInitiated health impacting event. Examples are Planned, Unplanned etc.

healthEventId.description: It is a unique Id that identifies the event

resolutionETA.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable and the reasonType is not User Initiated, it provides the date and time for when the issue is expected to be resolved.

occuredTime.description: Timestamp for when last change in health status occurred.

reportedTime.description: Timestamp for when the health was last checked.

recentlyResolved.description: An annotation describing a change in the availabilityState to Available from Unavailable with a reasonType of type Unplanned

unavailableOccuredTime.description: Timestamp for when the availabilityState changed to Unavailable

resolvedTime.description: Timestamp when the availabilityState changes to Available.

unavailableSummary.description: Brief description of cause of the resource becoming unavailable.

recommendedActions.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

items.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

actionUrlText.description: Substring of action, it describes which text should host the action URL.

serviceImpactingEvents.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

items.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

eventStartTime.description: Timestamp for when the event started.

eventStatusLastModifiedTime.description: Timestamp for when event was submitted/detected.

status.description: Status of the service impacting event.

incidentProperties.description: Properties of the service impacting event.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page of availabilityStatuses. Call ListNext() with this URI to fetch the next page of availabilityStatuses.

parameters.description: Specifies from when to return events (default is 3 days), based on the lastUpdateTime property. For example, queryStartTime = 7/24/2020 OR queryStartTime=7%2F24%2F2020

parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: The list of current service health events in the subscription

parameters.description: It provides a map of parameter name and value

impactMitigationTime.description: It provides the Timestamp for when the health impacting event resolved.

impactedTenants.description: List tenant impacted by the service health event.

items.description: Tenant impacted by the service health event.

summary.description: Summary text for the given update for the service health event.

eventTags.description:
A list of metadata tags associated with the event. Possible values include:
 -Action Recommended: Action may be required by you to avoid possible disruptions or mitigate risks for your services. It is recommended to evaluate these actions and the potential impact on your services. 
- False Positive: After investigation, we've determined your service is healthy and service issues did not impact your services as originally communicated.
- Preliminary PIR: For our largest, most impactful service issues a Preliminary Post Incident Review (PIR) is published generally within 72 hours of mitigation, to summarize what we have learned so far from the still-in-progress investigation.
- Final PIR: For service issues, a Final Post Incident Review (PIR) may be published to provide additional details or learnings. Sometimes this requires us to complete an internal retrospective, generally within 14 days of mitigation.

get.description: Gets current availability status for a single resource

parameters.name: resourceUri
parameters.description: The fully qualified ID of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. Currently the API only support one nesting level resource types : /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{parentResourceType}/{parentResourceName}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Setting $expand=recommendedactions in url query expands the recommendedactions in the response.

200.description: The body contains the current availability status for a single resource

id.description: Azure Resource Manager Identity for the availabilityStatuses resource.

type.description: Microsoft.ResourceHealth/AvailabilityStatuses.

location.description: Azure Resource Manager geo location of the resource.

availabilityState.description: Availability status of the resource. When it is null, this availabilityStatus object represents an availability impacting event

title.description: Title description of the availability status.

summary.description: Summary description of the availability status.

reasonType.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are planned, unplanned, user initiated or an outage etc.

context.description: When an event is created, it can either be triggered by a customer or the platform of the resource and this field will illustrate that. This field is connected to the category field in this object.

category.description: When a context field is set to Platform, this field will reflect if the event was planned or unplanned. If the context field does not have a value of Platform, then this field will be ignored.

rootCauseAttributionTime.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it provides the Timestamp for when the health impacting event was received.

healthEventType.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes when the health impacting event was originated. Examples are Lifecycle, Downtime, Fault Analysis etc.

healthEventCause.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are PlatformInitiated, UserInitiated etc.

healthEventCategory.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes the category of a PlatformInitiated health impacting event. Examples are Planned, Unplanned etc.

healthEventId.description: It is a unique Id that identifies the event

resolutionETA.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable and the reasonType is not User Initiated, it provides the date and time for when the issue is expected to be resolved.

occuredTime.description: Timestamp for when last change in health status occurred.

reportedTime.description: Timestamp for when the health was last checked.

recentlyResolved.description: An annotation describing a change in the availabilityState to Available from Unavailable with a reasonType of type Unplanned

unavailableOccuredTime.description: Timestamp for when the availabilityState changed to Unavailable

resolvedTime.description: Timestamp when the availabilityState changes to Available.

unavailableSummary.description: Brief description of cause of the resource becoming unavailable.

recommendedActions.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

items.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

actionUrlText.description: Substring of action, it describes which text should host the action URL.

serviceImpactingEvents.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

items.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

eventStartTime.description: Timestamp for when the event started.

eventStatusLastModifiedTime.description: Timestamp for when event was submitted/detected.

status.description: Status of the service impacting event.

incidentProperties.description: Properties of the service impacting event.

eventTags.description:
A list of metadata tags associated with the event. Possible values include:
 -Action Recommended: Action may be required by you to avoid possible disruptions or mitigate risks for your services. It is recommended to evaluate these actions and the potential impact on your services. 
- False Positive: After investigation, we've determined your service is healthy and service issues did not impact your services as originally communicated.
- Preliminary PIR: For our largest, most impactful service issues a Preliminary Post Incident Review (PIR) is published generally within 72 hours of mitigation, to summarize what we have learned so far from the still-in-progress investigation.
- Final PIR: For service issues, a Final Post Incident Review (PIR) may be published to provide additional details or learnings. Sometimes this requires us to complete an internal retrospective, generally within 14 days of mitigation.

items.description: availabilityStatus of a resource.

id.description: Azure Resource Manager Identity for the availabilityStatuses resource.

type.description: Microsoft.ResourceHealth/AvailabilityStatuses.

location.description: Azure Resource Manager geo location of the resource.

availabilityState.description: Availability status of the resource. When it is null, this availabilityStatus object represents an availability impacting event

title.description: Title description of the availability status.

summary.description: Summary description of the availability status.

reasonType.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are planned, unplanned, user initiated or an outage etc.

context.description: When an event is created, it can either be triggered by a customer or the platform of the resource and this field will illustrate that. This field is connected to the category field in this object.

category.description: When a context field is set to Platform, this field will reflect if the event was planned or unplanned. If the context field does not have a value of Platform, then this field will be ignored.

rootCauseAttributionTime.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable, it provides the Timestamp for when the health impacting event was received.

healthEventType.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes when the health impacting event was originated. Examples are Lifecycle, Downtime, Fault Analysis etc.

healthEventCause.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes where the health impacting event was originated. Examples are PlatformInitiated, UserInitiated etc.

healthEventCategory.description: In case of an availability impacting event, it describes the category of a PlatformInitiated health impacting event. Examples are Planned, Unplanned etc.

healthEventId.description: It is a unique Id that identifies the event

resolutionETA.description: When the resource's availabilityState is Unavailable and the reasonType is not User Initiated, it provides the date and time for when the issue is expected to be resolved.

occuredTime.description: Timestamp for when last change in health status occurred.

reportedTime.description: Timestamp for when the health was last checked.

recentlyResolved.description: An annotation describing a change in the availabilityState to Available from Unavailable with a reasonType of type Unplanned

unavailableOccuredTime.description: Timestamp for when the availabilityState changed to Unavailable

resolvedTime.description: Timestamp when the availabilityState changes to Available.

unavailableSummary.description: Brief description of cause of the resource becoming unavailable.

recommendedActions.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

items.description: Lists actions the user can take based on the current availabilityState of the resource.

actionUrlText.description: Substring of action, it describes which text should host the action URL.

serviceImpactingEvents.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

items.description: Lists the service impacting events that may be affecting the health of the resource.

eventStartTime.description: Timestamp for when the event started.

eventStatusLastModifiedTime.description: Timestamp for when event was submitted/detected.

status.description: Status of the service impacting event.

incidentProperties.description: Properties of the service impacting event.

nextLink.description: The URI to fetch the next page of availabilityStatuses. Call ListNext() with this URI to fetch the next page of availabilityStatuses.

QueryStartTimeParameter.name: queryStartTime
QueryStartTimeParameter.description: Specifies from when to return events (default is 3 days), based on the lastUpdateTime property. For example, queryStartTime = 7/24/2020 OR queryStartTime=7%2F24%2F2020
